adjective.description: Not directly caused by or resulting from something.
examples: full employment would have an indirect effect on wage levels

adjective.description: (of a route) not straight; not following the shortest way.
Avoiding direct mention or exposition of a subject.
examples: an indirect attack on the Senator

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense not in full grammatical concord): from medieval Latin indirectus, from in- not + directus (see direct).
